Posts.Content: Same thing with me. I had #30 sunscreen on but could only be out in the sun for 20 min. before I turned red and itchy. I was told it was from both the chemo and tamoxifen.
Posts.Title: Tamoxifen and sun exposure

Posts.Content: That's the "cocktail" I had and each treatment was different but I was tired after each one. I called them my crash down days. I had treatment on Wed. and by Sat. - Sun. I was down for the count. Cried all day Monday, and better by Tues. and back to work on Wed. I'd work one week the start all over again the following week. MyTurnNow is right--it varies from person to person so hopefully you wont have these side effects.
Posts.Title: C&A

Posts.Content: Don't feel dumb. You can still get the info if you want it. I'm a very detailed person so I wanted as much info as I could get. My surgeon gave me a copy of both my pathology reports and went through it with me so I would know how to read it. I had to have 2 surgeries to get clear margins = 2 reports. I have copies of all my test results and asked a bunch of questions. I found an error in one of my mammogram reports after surgery. It said my cancer was in the right breast when it was the left. I made them revise it so it would be correct. Sher
Posts.Title: Grade 3 of 3

Posts.Content: Cancer cells are graded by how much they look like normal cells. Grade 1 means the cancer cells look like normal cells and aren't considered aggressive. Grade 3 cancers are more likely to grow fast. This along with it's stage, 0 being lowest and 4 being the highest, and size of tumer determines the treatment. Having no node involvement is great. Sounds like yours was caught early. I am stage 1C, grade 3, no nodes, estrogen and progesterone positive, and HER2 positive. Like you, I had a partial mastectomy, chemo, radiation, one year of herceptin, now 5 years of Tamoxifen to disable the hormones that my cancer feeds on. None of it was (is) fun, but it's doable. Best of luck Sher
Posts.Title: Grade 3 of 3

Posts.Content: WOW 150mg? I'm on 37.5 and it works great. I would call your oncol. about lowering the dose.
Posts.Title: effexor for hot flashes

Posts.Content: I had my head shaved after my second treatment. It bothered me more to have it fall out in strands then to get rid of it. I wore scarves instead of a wig--hate tight things on my head. Walmart has some really pretty bandanas that I wore.
Posts.Title: should I go ahead and shave my head

Posts.Content: Yes, I sleep anywhere from 6-8 hours each night. Ask your oncol. or PC about it.
Posts.Title: effexor for hot flashes

Posts.Content: After the night sweats got so bad I was awake every hour and so sleep deprived I knew I needed help. It has helped. I'm on a low dose 37.5 mg tab so I don't have any side effects. I take it in the morning with my tamoxefin. I'm also on Ambien that helps keep my asleep. My nights are now peaceful. Sher
Posts.Title: effexor for hot flashes

Posts.Content: Thanks Traci, I'll take a look at it. I think I'm just a bit behind you in treatment...finished rads 1/19 still doing the herceptin until Oct. and start tamoxefin next week...on to the next step of this journey.
Posts.Title: Another book recommendation for post-treatment

Posts.Content: I bumped up another thread on this for you.
Posts.Title: tomoxafin and leg cramps

Posts.Content: CALMNESS IN OUR LIVES OVER THE HOLIDAYS I am passing this on to you because it definitely works and we could all use a little more calmness in our lives. By following simple advice heard on the Oprah show, you too can find inner peace. Dr. Oz proclaimed, 'The way to achieve inner peace is to finish all the things you have started and have never finished.' So, I looked around my house to see all the things I started and hadn't finished, and before leaving the house this morning, I finished off a bottle of White Zinfandel, a bottle of Tequila, a package of Oreos, the remainder of my old Prozac prescription, the rest of the cheesecake, some Doritos, and a box of chocolates. You have no idea how freaking good I feel right now! Pass this on if you know anyone you think might be in need of inner peace. HAPPY HOLIDAYS!!
Posts.Title: CALMNESS IN OUR LIVES OVER THE HOLIDAYS

Posts.Content: I had echos. Wasn't given a choice. I was also on Herceptin for 1 year.
Posts.Title: echo better than muga scan

Posts.Content: 10 years is a long time to fight anything. Huge hugs, prayers and good thoughts coming to you! Sher
Posts.Title: Benefit for a friend, need prayers

Posts.Content: My surgeon said the survival rate was the same for mastectomy vs. lumpectomy with radiation. I went for the lumpectomy. Mine was 2+cm, triple+, stage 1C, grade 3, clear nodes. To quote my oncol. "we're looking at a full cure" when done with all the treatments. You have to trust your medical team and can't second guess them. My arm and breast is still sore and my surgeries (I had to have a second to get clear margins) was last June. I was told it takes 1 year from the end of treatment to get back to "normal". I laughed and said you mean I'll be normal after this??? lol! Take one treatment at a time, don't think about what happens next just deal with now. I put all the info about radiation away until I was done with chemo then pulled it out to educate myself on what to expect.
Posts.Title: Update since surgery 4/23/10** I am sore and scared again full of sad emotions?

Posts.Content: I love my red Tacoma 4 x 4 pickup with extended cab. I waited 11 years to get this truck (that's what I get for listening to family instead of myself)and wouldn't drive anything but a truck now. Sher
Posts.Title: Aortus and his new car .. Joe here are a few suggestions for you, from your fellow Kindered Spirits

Posts.Content: OMG Mama G, you've been put through the ringer. You're in my prayers and sending good thoughts your way. Sher

Posts.Content: Sorry it hurt. I was so happy to look down after putting on a tee-shirt and not seeing a "bump". Sher

Posts.Title: age when diagnosed?

Posts.Content: I had my lumpectomy in June 2009 and was told by my surgeon not to touch it for 4 months. The tissue was moved around a lot in there and it needs to heal. My breast has changed shape a few times since June...both chemo and rads change the shape and feel of it. Talk to your doctor on Monday to set your mind as rest.
Posts.Title: Feeling scared again!

Posts.Content: Have you tried your local ASC? They have a 24 hour hotline so if you can't travel to them maybe you can talk on the phone?? I hope you feel better soon.
Posts.Title: still can't find a support group

Posts.Content: I forgot to comment on your crying...with me it was a reaction to the chemo and all the other drugs. I had chemo every 2 weeks on a Wed. by the following Sun. I cried all day so I just went with it and planned on Sundays being my cry day, by Monday I was better. As a friend told me we can deal with anything as long as we know what the rules are. Hope you're feeling better today. Sher
Posts.Title: Feeling scared again!

Posts.Content: With all of us holding on to you, there's no way you're going to be flying away. Many hugs, prayers, and well wishes coming to you. Sher

Posts.Content: With all of us holding on to you, there's no way you're going to be flying away. Many hugs, prayers, and well wishes coming to you. Sher

Posts.Content: I would check with your hair stylist--mine told me to wait 6 months after treatment. I lucked out so far my hair has come back darker and with less gray then I had before.
Posts.Title: It's the Hair

Posts.Content: Traci, once again you made me laugh! I love your humor. Congrats, Congrats, Congrats! So happy for you. Keep your dancing shoes on for awhile. Sher
Posts.Title: Hands off, girls -- NED is all mine today!

Posts.Content: Hi Pinkvictory. Sorry to hear you're so wiped out. I had the A/C every 2 weeks with the Neulastra shot. Every treatment reaction was different for me. Ask your doc. for pain meds. There's no reason for you to be in pain. Listen to your body and do what it tells you to do. Now's the time for you to be taken care of. Your job is to fight the cancer. Best of luck Sher
Posts.Title: New to discussions and have questions

Posts.Content: I use Visine natural tears formula for dry eye. Sounds strange but your eyes express more tears when they are dry. The natural tears was recommended by my oncol. But like Kay said ask your oncol. for his/her recommedation.
Posts.Title: Moisturizing eyedrops

Posts.Content: When we started talking percentages, I didn't know what mine was so I looked at my pathology report again. It was listed there--mine is 90% ER/PR+--that means I'm staying on the tamoxefin.
Posts.Title: No tamoxifen for me
